Welcome to the Nobody General

>Who is the Nobody?
The Nobody is a figure alive today who has extraordinary spiritual powers, including the ability to influence reality with his conscious and unconscious mind, and intuitively receive guidance from the forces of Heaven.
He works to elevate people to their true potential, opposing those who seek power over others. He is a homoplasmate, a divine syzygy; the coalition between man and holy spirit. Which means the collective appreciation of a neo-Enochian bicameral consciousness that is rushing into widespread experience.

He isn't a messiah; he's just like you, but he has found the kingdom of God within himself through sheer dedication, just like you will. Remember that it's you who creates your own reality; with your hands, thoughts, feelings, words. No one can decide your fate except for you and God.

>What is the general picture?
It’s important we start replying more to the good posters and ignoring the hateful ones, or educating them if possible. So call upon their heads the forces of Heaven for peace, clarity, and wisdom. If this place is to be more than a squandered opportunity, an overgrown garden, it requires voices such as yours, but many more. This is a place for spiritual discussions and help, not drama, attention seeking, or social content; there are other boards for that.

Focus on increasing your service to all and be more loving to yourself and everyone in order to raise your vibrational and consciousness level, and learn to forgive yourself and others. This will change the vibration of the planet and raise our shared consciousness, making us a better humankind one person at a time.
None of us are perfect, it is by learning to admit and accept this fact one is able to learn, and grow in Truth. Heaven for all is real. Everyone's truest desires are mutual. The only motive is love.

If this is your first time here, just remember, it’s going to be ok, you may take shelter and find rest.

Dude this shit is wildly overblown. It can absolutely happen, but if you're smart about it and in a good headspace a mushroom trip can be exceptionally valuable. Shit like this happens to people who are basically primed for these symptoms they may have just been dormant and were likely going to appear, being brought on by some sort of traumatic event.

Don't start with a 5g hero dose. Start with 2-3.5g if you want a trip, or try a microdose which is about .25g.

Just make sure you're in a good place mentally, and tripping in a safe place monitored by someone not tripping. Always have some kind of a benzodiazapine on hand. Benzos absolutely destroy a trip so if youre having a bad one you can have your monitor just toss a xanax in your mouth, and your anxiety will dissipate and the trip effects will diminish significantly.

posts.name: Anonymous

>>34045426
Qi Gong and Tai chi are maybe the best examples of this, as well as corruption of understanding.
Alot of people look at these and go 'das bull shite' because charlatans promote the practices for those as a means to an end in of themselves.
But these in particular were meant to develop the energy at an incredibly subtle level, when spiritual illiteracy took over people had no clue how to use these. They reduced it down to a kind of dance.
All of these practices in northern-eastern asia (IE; japan, Korea, China) root back to bodhidharma's transmission. How legitimate that is can be questioned, but it illuminates their purpose from the very beginning. It was always meant to be secondary to the meditation, never the practice in of itself.
If you don't understand meditation, you're not gonna get anything out of these beyond maybe some physical health benefits. It's more apparent with these systems in particular because they were developed with the meditation energy (life force/prana/qi/vriya/piti/whatever) as the main focus as the tool to repair and change the body. It was made for someone who already is cultivating their meditation.
Compared this to normal hindu-buddhist yoga, which cultivates the body to prepare for the meditation and enhance it, instead of the other way around.

The press secretary for the Pentagon said in comparison to the spy balloon's solar panels being the known payload we heard about being associated with the balloon, there was no "significant" payload associated with this particular object. They also said that it technically wasn't an aircraft, but according to the definition I picked above, it could have been flying but by means other than interacting with the air. Moreover, when the press secretary was asked "Was it flying at consistently at an altitude of roughly 40,000 feet that entire time?" He responded, "Roughly, yes." Later on, he also said "...this thing did not appear to be self-maneuvering and therefore at the mercy or prevailing winds and much less predictable." The pilots of the fighter aircraft that shot the object down "were able to determine that it likely was not manned." So we know so far:

- The object was flying (moving in the air with, or as with, wings; moving lightly or rapidly; intended for rapid movement).
- It's the size of a small car.
- It was likely unmanned.
- The object had an altitude of about 40,000 feet (see graphic).
- It didn't have a significant/important payload.
- It didn't appear to be self-maneuvering and had unpredictable movements.

It sounds like it could be a balloon again. It's moving with the wind/it's not self-maneuvering like a balloon would. It's approximately at the altitude you would expect from a surveillance balloon. It was probably unmanned, like a balloon would be. Maybe it's just a different type of surveillance balloon? It could also be a drone.

It is from an old religion. The Yantra are only really used by ayyanists which is a dravidian branch of hinduism that predates modern hinduism (kind of like what paganism is to modern religions). Here is the post that goes along with that picture from their patreon group:
This is the Karoopanayallayan Yantra for 6th - 15th Feb 2023.

This is different to the Arcanallayan Yantra (which is a Yantra that brings resonance with the Sun God Surya and positive Lokas). The Karoopanayallayan Yantra brings resonance with the Karoopanayal Tala Space but amplifies it on a 10 day basis by attaining resonance with two beings: Chandra (the Moon God) and Mada (the Demon born from the will of Chyavana). Thus it is made out of two Yantras: the every changing outer Chandra-Mada Yantra and the inner unchanging Karoopanayal Tala Yantra.

The Demon Mada is also known as Ukkandayyan in Dravidian Aaiyyani, and is an extremely powerful entity (so powerful that even Indra had to surrender to its power). So this combined Yantra: The Karoopanayallayan Yantra is incredibly powerful.

This Yantra shown will give you specific powerful negative energy for that week and was produced by a High Aaiyyanist. It will kick start each week with a great amount of negative energy that you can use for your own will. This is usually to gain wealth and power and commune with negative entities to gain their arcane knowledge.

As we are all part of the Marunatunilam School it is feasible to store positive energy and negative energy in our Chakra reservoirs to use as our will directs. They do not cancel each other out if you are correctly aligned in both paths. If you follow the non-Tantric path you can choose not to use this, and if you follow a Tantric path you may choose not to use the Arcanallayan Yantra. If you follow both paths as espoused by the Neutralist doctrine of Marunatunilam, then open both Yantras (Tala and Loka space).

>>34050212
The official hammer or staff is made of silver and is about 1.3 metres high. It forms a double axe in its upper part. A banner winds around the staff. The symbols and characters of this official hammer fall into four main groups.

- The creed of the Order (Templars), i.e. what the Order itself regards as the "Christian Apostolic Doctrine". This is written in Latin around the staff of the gavel.

- The main basic doctrines of God, of Adam-Adoniram the man and of salvation. Expressed by the symbols in the centre of the square plate on either side (Ae and Bf) and by the three-sided crystal prism standing on three steps above the plate.

- The special teachings of the essence of God, especially the teachings of the 10 Sephiroth and the corresponding "Names of God", of the world of angels, the world of stars and the world of the four elements, furthermore of the powers of the angelic and stralic world and their influence on the elemental world of man.

An old legend that's still a central part of Islam but actually predates it and was already present in Jewish and Christian tradition was that Satan along with all the other angels was commanded by God to bow before Adam; the other angels obeyed but Satan refused, which led to his ultimate fall and exile

Interestingly, some Sufis have interpreted this account as Satan refusing to bow to anyone except God and as a consequence his fall was a tragic demonstration of his unfaltering monotheism and love for God, while still others maintain that his primary error was his inability to see the image and essence of God in the "Universal Man"/Adam Kadmon that perfectly embodied all the qualities of the divine (and interestingly this also ties back around to the Christian doctrine of the incarnation and the ultimate unity of God and Man)

Functionally, I think it's pretty commonly accepted that Satan is an enemy to literally everyone: God, man, angels, ultimately his own demons and even himself - his title itself means "adversary" and that applies to everything, to the point of him undermining the very source of his own being

>>34055626
Uh, no, not quite

The Hebrews definitely had a concept of evil spiritual beings; even if they weren't always called "Satan" specifically, there are absolutely supernatural entities in the Old Testament who are depicted as personifications of evil - examples such as the "Sons of God" (or the "Watchers" as they later came to be known in Enochic traditions) in Genesis, "Leviathan the twisting serpent" in Isaiah, or the "anointed cherub in Eden" all come to mind

Stuff like Leviathan, Rahab, Samael, and Lilith was never absent from Judaism and if you want proof you can actually see that the latter literally shows up in the Epic of Gilgamash, the Jews in the Second Temple period didn't just pull all of this stuff out of their asses wholesale, the seeds of the ideas for malevolent angelic beings that had defected from YHWH's divine court, the idea of a Satan who has "fallen like lightning from heaven" was already cemented pretty deeply into the Hebrew religious psyche by the time of Jesus as can be demonstrated by libraries from that time like the Dead Sea Scrolls

Jews, Christians, and Muslims alike all had a very clear understanding of a "Satan" figure for centuries before Milton was even born

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
1) Dreams are an oniric mirror of the real life and the mind of the dreamer. It is an extension of your consciousness while you are resting.
2) True interpretation requires intimate knowledge of the minute life of the dreamer and his mind. The dreamer holds the key to interpret his own dreams and figure out the correlation of the events in the dream to the corresponding situations in real life.
3) I consider dreams to be immersive "workshops" to work out issues, like a videogame's practice mode. Actions in dreams do not have consequences once you wake up. No one has ever been hospitalized because of an accident in a dream.
4) Dreams do not predict the future in and out of themselves. They have no hold on real life. They are not external messages from the spirit world*. You will not access "information" you are not already privy to in your real life, although some bits of it that you are aware of may take new forms and be combined and rearranged in creative ways. So-called "prophetic" dreams are either coincidences or self-fulfilled prophecies.
*I regretfully include this bit even though I hate to discount the possibility that dreams are a portal to or from an external extraordinary world. I have dreamed of my mother in a very positive way soon after her death and it was very comforting at the time as I believed it was her own soul contacting me. However I now hold the view that the dream world is for all practical purposes, internally generated. I am not interested in denying other people's unexplained or paranormal experiences, but I cannot honestly support such claims with my own experience either.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>34058104
5) However, revelations or certainties that have been brewing subconsciously in one's mind for a time may finally surface within a dream, and as such affect real life. In other words, you may access your intuition in a more vivid form.
6) Dreams are not always about life or death issues, but may often about trivial situations. They are no less useful but their importance should not be exaggerated.
7) Nightmares have a very positive connotation for the dreamer and should be embraced. They are simulations which prepares you psychologically for future difficulties and challenges. If you wake up from a nightmare and feel relieved that it is over, consider your day blessed.
8) Not all details in a dream have a profound meaning. There is a lot of randomly generated "noise" that is not worth pondering about, especially if you have no special emotional reaction to it within the dream. Dreams are not David Lynch movies, mathematical equations or puzzles to be solved, even though they certainly are cryptic, fickle and frustrating to interpret.
9) A good first step to interpret a dream is to focus on your emotional responses within them. The stronger the emotion, the more there is to take away from this part of the dream.

>Can anyone project/shift/have an out of body experience?
Yes.

>Is it not just a vivid lucid dream?
No. A full successful astral projection/shift/oobe feels just as, and often even more real than the waking reality you're experiencing right now. The difference between this and even extremely vivid lucid dreams is absolutely huge.

>Does it have to be difficult and take me months/years to attain this ability?
No, it does not, the only barrier is your mind - both conscious and subconscious. If you think it's going to be difficult, it will. Many people can be successful within their first few tries.

>How come? And how is even this connected to astral travel?
There exists an infinite amount of realities with infinite "you's" into which you can focus your conscious awareness. Astral projection and other OOBEs are, in essence, the same thing - projecting your consciousness into the Astral Plane etc.

>Do I have to come back?
Not from shifting.
Yes from projecting, but also somewhat up for debate.

>Does this have anything to do with the teenager trend spreading on TikTok and in other places?
Yes and no. Kids latching onto an idea they may not even understand, pay them no attention.

I have had OpenAI beta access for some time.
I've tested it and used it, and I do have experience with many other chatbots and AI systems.

ChatGPT is far more advanced than anything humanity has put forth as a chatbot so far.

It's code is capable of ascertaining many details of a conversation from context. This thing isn't making character by character predictions, or word by word predictions. It is looking at entire sentences, and making contextual predictions based on the entire conversation relative to those sentences and keywords within. It even appears to go so far as paragraph context comparison.

Now, the pool of data it has to make these comparisons worthwhile, is absolutely massive. So the predictions are very good, outstandingly so.

Yes, if you want to tinker and fuck with it, you can find flaws, but I assure you, by and large, this thing is incredible.

It's comparing words, verbage, sentence structure, paragraph syntax, whole conversation context, and noun/verb context against it's massive training database.

It may still be "mechanical" and a "dumb AI" but it is really above the rest by a WIDE margin.

It's easy to mistake what it's doing as thinking, because the output you receive from it, is what a thinking process would provide.

We're essentially reverse engineering "intelligent thought processes" from front to back.

It doesn't have an internal monologue, but it has an internal process that mimics large parts of higher order thought.
When you, yourself think about the context of a sentence for a language you speak, it's intuitive and fast, you're comparing that information against the database of knowledge you have in your brain.

This thing is doing much the same, but at speeds much faster than you can. It has no sense of self, but the processes it uses that mimic thought processes? Those are lightning fast, compared to the human brain equivalents.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>34058099

The time it takes you to recall detailed information from a memory, like the color of a shirt that a person was wearing while they went to the movies with you... In the same amount of time you recalled that single detail, ChatGPT could have initiated about 1000 queries of it's own "memory" database and pulled answers as dictated by it's contextual analysis of the sentence.

This thing does not have the lag time of a human brain. It is operating at electron speed for things that we have to fire large networks of neurons around for measurable amounts of seconds. It's latency for the same processes is in the range of 1ms.

That's right, for the 1 second you take to remember a detail, this thing can do the same in 0.001 seconds.

It's not conscious, but it's fucking fast as shit, and has more than a human's brain worth of 100% precise information stored in it's database. (I can't guarantee the information is accurate, but it is precise.)
ChatGPT does not suffer from "fuzzy memory" or have "missing details" like the long term memory issues in a human brain.

So, these are the major advantages.

We have made this stuff more efficient than the human mind thought process equivalents, even though we haven't given it any form of actual sentience.

It "thinks" about 1000 times faster than you.

So, knowing all this, you may still be asking, "What's the big deal?"

Well, you need to think about what utilizing this thing will enable you to do.

A good analogy to get you in the right mindset for what I mean is the calculator.

For the average person, complex math can potentially be done in their head, and before calculators it was either that, or write it out with pen and paper to solve the problem.

Those processes took at best several seconds, for very complex problems, or very slow solvers, it could take minutes.

The addition of the electronic calculator reduced the amount of time needed for these situations to less than 10 seconds for nearly all problems. You end up just limited by the speed you can press the buttons.

So, with AI, you will be able to save a whole shitload of time for a lot of things, you just need to learn how to "press AI's calculator buttons"

Here, let me show you something.

This is a conversation I had with ChatGPT.

I asked it how long it would take an individual programmer to learn how to code up a simple GAN for image generation.

ChatGPT estimated weeks to months.

I then asked ChatGPT to generate code for a simple GAN for me that would be capable of image generation.

ChatGPT did this in about 5 seconds.

I then asked it to explain details of the code to me, line by line, and it performed that as well.

Any words of phrases it used in it's description, I could ask it for more detail on, and get it to explain the meaning of the words to me.

I was essentially forcing it to teach me what each piece of this code did, so, if I wanted to, I could learn what it told me would take a programmer weeks or months to learn on their own, within a few minutes to a couple hours of reading and having a conversation with the AI.

You can use this thing as a teacher/tutor, to learn shit at the practical use level.

How much would you have to pay a human, who has the necessary coding knowledge about coding GAN's and AI models to sit there and tutor you for an hour or two?

Now remember, all of ChatGPT's information is 100% precise. A human teacher might not explain with the same level of precise information.

I don't know ANY python.

I actually used ChatGPT to generate a python script so I could make calls to it's API from my Windows Powershell.
The first time I tried to run the script, I got an error.
What did I do? I copy/pasted the error to ChatGPT.
ChatGPT explained exactly why I got the error, what the error details meant, and gave me exact steps on how to fix the error.

Within 10 minutes I had the script working, and I made a successful API call to OpenAI from my Powershell terminal, via a python script, and I have never coded python in my life.

This. This is far more than "better Googling"

When they train ChatGPT they're using a VERY substantial database of information.

"I was trained on a diverse range of internet text, including web pages, books, and scientific articles. The total size of the training data was over 45 terabytes, which is equivalent to 45,000 gigabytes."

For this thing to be trained on this data, it had to go through a learning process to "learn it".

That learning process basically means that it was parsing the 45 terabytes of data, hundreds if not thousands of times and building on-to it's model based on the "learning process".

At the end it's a data throughput on the order of petabytes.

This process takes a fuck-ton of computing resources.

OpenAI nearly bankrupted themselves, just paying for the compute time to train ChatGPT.

Which is one of the major reasons they needed massive cash injections from Microsoft.
(Microsoft has given them about 11 billion dollars so far.)
The majority of the money was spent on compute time, for training the AI.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>34018070
>>34018626
>In what world?
Could be some infrasound bullshit that's louder than footsteps but with a frequency below our ear's ability to hear. It would explain the feeling of pressure and unease. If the alleyway was located between two old industrial buildings, there is a chance that some machinery is still running or, if totally abandoned, some element of its infrastructure is still connected to the larger grid. Electrical equipment can hum very loudly, and steam pipes can vibrate/knock against their surroundings. The sounds from such things could be muffled by brick/masonry/earth, all but silencing their audible components, while the lower, inaudible frequencies escape. It is also possible that the nature of the alley itself serves to amplify this infrasound, bouncing it back and forth between the walls, while blocking external noises like wind from entering.

i dont have much to say to preface this story. you can believe it or not. this is just how events unfolded for me.

>work a nurse job for a wildlife rehab center

>my job is to just clean out cages, fill food bowls, occasionally watch over and let the more unreleasable animals play around, etc.

>we've been getting a shocking amount of opossums turning up severely wounded, to the point we've had to start euthanizing some because we were simply too understaffed to help them

>opossums show up all the time at the center, its not too weird for an animal who reacts to any and all danger by freezing in place and falling over

>usually injuries are broken bones, or consistent with getting hit by cars

>these injuries are much different. they're missing patches of fur with holes the size of quarters carved into their flesh about 2-3 inches deep

>something about it made even the experienced veterinarians at the rehab center feel sick seeing it, but we tried to patch up as many as we could

>according to one of the vets they were also missing a shit ton of blood, most were barely even able to still limp

>I get assigned one of the opossums who hasn't been injured as bad, only has one of the holes near its stomach. docs already got it patched up, my job is to just watch over it and help it get back on its feet. it needs special attention due to the blood loss

>skip ahead 2-3 days. we're still getting more and more opossums with these injuries. the owner of the rehab center decides to contact the local game wardens about this, we're suspecting animal cruelty at this point and they take notes and decide to start going on the look out for whatever's causing this

>the opossum i got assigned (i called him Grapes because that seemed to be his favorite food) has healed quite well and most of the opossums are in a good state to be released back into the wild.

cont.

I got a story for you all. It's been a few years but I still remember it like it happened yesterday. Kinda annoying to be typing it out in greentext on a European keyboard but fuck it, tradition and all that.
>be 21, best friend just got his permanent driver's license and wants to use his car to go camping in the Alps in the south of France
>it's me and 2 friends including the one with the car
>we're thinking we can drive from Belgium all the way to the south of France in one day, so we leave in the morning
>after hours of driving and a lot of stress for my best buddy (he's the only one who could drive), we decide to camp out in the middle of bumfuck nowhere since it's getting dark
>this is somewhere in the south of France, no idea where exactly, but it was all small roads and forest all around us, with NO LIGHTS, not even streetlights.
>we find a clearing on the side of the road, park there, take our camping shit out of the trunk and head into the woods to find a suitable place to place our tent
>at this point the sun is almost gone and the forest is really dense, but luckily we find a clearing and quickly make a fire and set up our tent
>we boil some water over the campfire in our pot and eat our instant noodles, smoke a cigarette, piss out the fire and get in the (cramped) tent to go to sleep
>this is a small tent so it had us lying in there shoulder to shoulder, all three of us next to each other, with me on the left side. It's a full moon so there's some of that light shining through the canopy of trees on to the FRONT of our tent (this is important)
>I'm an insomniac so I was probably lying there with my eyes closed for about half an hour, when a light source to the left of me caught my attention through my closed eyelids
>I open my eyes, look to my left and I see what looks like a flash light in the distance, about 100 meters away, shining right onto our tent
cont.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
(2/3)
>I figure it's a forest ranger coming to tell us we can't camp here or some shit, so I whisper to the other guys and ask if they're awake
>they are, and they see the light too
>we're discussing what to say to the guy when he inevitable tells us off, and we decide our bilingual dutch/french speaking friend is to handle it since me and my buddy can't speak french for shit
>all the while this light is coming closer
>at a certain distance, I would say about 20 meters away from the tent (keep in mind it's hard to gauge distance of an outside light source when inside a tent in a pitch black forest (except for the moonlight)) the light just suddenly goes out completely
>all of us shut the fuck up for a while but we hear nothing, literally dead silent environment
>after about 30 seconds I break the silence and ask the guys what the fuck that light was, of course they didn't know either
>remember earlier I said the moon was shining on the front of our tent? Well I look to the front of the tent and I see a fucking shadowy figure standing literally RIGHT IN FRONT of our tent, its silhouette cast by the moonlight. From the angle we were in you could clearly make out a torso, LONG arms to the side and about half of the length of its legs, but the head wasn't projected on the tent
>internally I'm freaking the fuck out at this point so I grab my puny ass swiss army knife and look over to the guys, they see it too
>my bilingual friend starts saying shit in french to this figure, "hello?" "who are you?" stuff to that effect
>no answer, this figure is just standing there with its long arms by its side, motionless
>at this point I'm convinced some fucking lunatic is ready to murder or rape us and my survival instinct takes over, so I open the swiss knife, silently grab the zipper and then as quickly as I could I opened the tent and just jumped out to try to tackle this person to the ground in one fell swoop
cont.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
(3/3)
>I jump out and... There is nothing there
>nothing at all
>me and my friends look around the tent, we shine our flash light behind the closest trees, nothing
>now this is what makes it extra freaky
>it was the middle of a dry summer and the forest floor was littered with dry ass sticks and leaves
>no fucking WAY anyone could step over to our tent without making a single sound, man nor animal, let alone nope out of there in the split second it took me to open the tent
>this thing, whatever it was, somehow was able to sneak up to the front of our tent without stepping on the fucking floor
>to rule out pareidolia I went back in the tent, closed it up and looked to see if the figure we saw was somehow a figment of our imagination caused by clouds passing by the moon or trees or whatever
>there were no shadows in front of our tent at all anymore
>my bilingual friend took a scareshit behind the closest tree and then we noped the fuck out of the forest to sleep in the car that night, we just left the tent in the forest and came back to pick it up the morning after
>rest of the trip was uneventful
Anyone have any idea what we witnessed that night? I've googled cryptids from France but nothing came up that matched what we saw that night. If anyone of you has any ideas, please let me know. This is by far the creepiest shit me and my friends ever witnessed and it's a complete mystery.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
This wasn't paranormal but true crime very similar to a scene in "The Strangers".

In 1993 I was home alone when I was 12 years old, as my Mom was out with her girlfriends and wouldn't be back till after midnight. I was used to being by myself at night for at least half the week, my Mom wasn't exactly mother of the year, so I wasn't frightened or anything.

Until about 9:45 that evening.

I heard a knock on our glass storm front door. I was immediately freaked out because the house we rented was secluded and off a road that wasn't used that much. We never even met our closest neighbors, as the closest home was was easily over 200 yards away, with a lot of vegetation in between. So I figured maybe I'll finally meet them. Instead who I meet creeped me out hard.

Very similar to that scene from "The Strangers", it was a blonde, scrawny, strung out chick, covered in track marks. She had also unscrewed the bulb of our front porch light to hide her appearance. I opened the front door but still had the storm glass door locked.

Thank God too because before she said a word, she was yanking on it. "Is Josh here? I'm his cousin, let me in, I need to see him!" she yelled.

I was freaked out but instinctively knew this was a setup for a robbery or worse. "No one lives here named Josh, lady. Stop yanking on my screen!" I cried.

She just stopped then and looked at me with harsh, cold, dead eyes. Softly muttering "Josh" under her breath. Just then, hiding to the left of the screen door, a small man appeared, startling me. "Open NOW!" he screamed, kicking the glass exterior door and putting a huge crack in it. I was lucky it held. I immediately slammed the front door shut, locking the dead bolt. He kicked it again, smashing it and proceeded to start SWAT team kicking the front door. I ran to the kitchen and called 911, but heard another kicked that sounded like it was going to collapse at any moment.

I remembered my Mom had a "Lady Smith .38" in her side dresser, so I ran into her room, snatched it and immediately positioned myself in the hallway aiming at the door.

"I've called the police! I have a gun!" I yelled on the top of lungs. BOOM! Another kick. Just then, right behind me I heard the window in our kitchen shatter. I ran into the kitchen, startled to see the stung out, bleach blonde chick crawling thru, one hand already on the rim of the sink. She looked up, saw I was armed and pulled back out, cutting her hand in the process.

BOOM! Another kick but this time with the sound of hinges getting ripped off wood.

I froze. I didn't know which room to protect myself in. Paralyzed with fear that either way someone is getting in as I couldn't be in the hallway and kitchen at the same time.

I heard yelling outside, possibly the girl telling the man I had a gun, but couldn't be sure. "NO! Fuck that little shit, he's DYING NOW!" I heard the man yell. Just then I heard the operator on the phone, sitting on the kitchen counter.

"Hello? Hello? Can you speak to me please?" I yelled as loud as I could "Send the police now! My address is XXXXXXX."

BOOM! Another kick; at this point the front door had splintered both of its hinges. I knew one more kick and it'd would come down. I decided to fire the .38 in the air to show them I was armed. Click. Click. Clink. It wasn't fucking loaded. My Mom had a pistol, that I come to find out later, but never bought bullets.

BOOM! BOOM! BOOM! I could hear the man screaming in frustration, but the door held by some miracle.

Then silence. I stood there between the hallway and the kitchen for what felt like hours. I remember hearing the operator threatening me with arrest if this was a prank.

And then they were gone. The police never even came that night either. Nor did my Mom. I sat curled up against a wall, too scared to even get up and talk on the phone.

Eventually, after 7 hours or so, I heard my Mom pull up. She found me shaking with her gun in my hands and instill of hugging me and comforting me, she accused me of breaking the door. Like I said, mother of the year. Once it dawned on her what really happened she called the police again. They finally came after an hour, and told us this couple had burglarized a home half a mile from ours and assaulted the old lady living there. Apparently they had been doing this for weeks in the town for drug money and we're eventually apprehended. The fucked up part was my Mom knew the girl. Her Mom had bought a couple of pieces of art from my Mom and that girl was actually in our home with her Mom a month ago, looking at my Mom's work!

A month later I was living with my Dad in another state. To this day, I still harbor resentment towards my Mom for not being there, not buying fucking bullets, and not comforting me at all initially.

A year later at the trial, I was called as a witness for the prosecution and both of them got suspended sentences and were back out on the streets in no time.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
gotta give some context for this story

used to live out in rural Missouri, about 30-40 miles west of STL. Every night around 10-11 PM every night, a Chinook helicopter would fly over the area including my house, heading west, probably heading towards the Missouri Army National Guard Base in Jefferson City or Fort Leonard Wood (which are 60 and 95 miles from where it passes over my house). happened every night so I was just kinda used to it flying over, tried taking pictures of it a few times.

>2017
>playing fallout 4, just hit 3 AM
>while playing, hear the helicopter pass over
>dont think too much of it
>around 5 minutes pass
>i hear the helicopter fly back over
>immediately weird to me (never flown over twice in one night)
>look out the window
>helicopter is flying much lower to the ground
>its got its spotlight on looking in the field of my neighbor's property (cattle farmer with a lot of land)
>circles around my property and neighbors property
>shines the light in a bunch of trees in the area
>few minutes pass and it takes off back west
>start thinking what the fuck could they possibly be looking for out here?
>another 5 minutes pass of nothing
>few minutes later it flies back over
>same thing, hovering low, spotlight on
>afraid to stand near the window because they definitely have infrared
>fully expecting a hail of bullets to gun me down from a machine gun if it get too close
>even more terrified of what the fuck could be out there that they're looking for
>helicopter hovering around looking for another 10 min
>flies off west again
>comes back 5 mins later again
>this time its got its search light on my house and property
>looking all in the trees and around tall grass
>i stand right next to the window to try see where the helicopter is at
>spotlight shines directly on me through the window
>i freeze
>right after, helicopter turns around and flies back west and didn't come back for the night
got a few more shorter stories
pic related is the helicopter

>be me

>get devastating news that my grandmother passed away, was really close to her
>can't fly to Newfoundland for her funeral because unvaxxed
>have to drive out by myself the 2000 kilometer (1250 miles) journey across the Trans-Labrador Highway
>one of the most remote, rarely travelled """""major""""" roads in North America
>not shitting you, it's so remote you'd probably be the only human being within 100 kilometers (60 miles) for most of the journey and you could go hours without seeing another car
>roughly 2 AM in the morning
>can barely keep my eyes open, promise myself I'll stop and sleep at the nearest truck stop (which up here are just tiny little pull-overs, no buildings or lights or signs or anything)
>pull into the next one, on the edge of a steep decline with a small stream at the bottom
>notice there's a motorcycle parked there, standing up with not a single person in sight
>???
>the owner's probably camping in the woods, don't care
>naturally paranoid fucker anyways so sleep with my doors locked and windows covered
>wake up around 10 in the morning
>motorcycle's still there, still no sign of anybody
>step outside to take a piss and get a better look over the decline at the stream in the day light
>there's a full pair of clothes and a motorcycle helmet just scattered all over the edge of the stream and a helmet
>a cooler that's been open and flung around with its contents (drinks and food) tossed around
>curiosity gets the better of me and I carefully scale down the steep decline and look around
>the stream passes under the road through a culvert which is only just a few feet from this scene

>already uneasy from reading /x/ greentexts

Maintenance Protocol
__________

Night

500mg Slo Niacin
100mg Pterostilbene
250mg Pomegranate Extract
Black Seed Oil (1 teaspoon)

>Tiredness, exhaustion, muscle soreness, increased chest or nasal discharge, cold or flu like symptoms, cold sores, headaches, rash, acne, irritability, change in stool frequency, volume or color; increased urination, bloated stomach, cramps, increased gas.

OREGANO DOSING GUIDE

For each morning and night dose you need a minimum of 40mg Carvacrol. Do not buy a product unless it is listed. Most products are steam distilled but you will want to confirm that.

POMEGRANATE DOSING GUIDE

NAC, Oregano Oil and Black Seed Oil have all been proven safe in clinical studies.

NAC has shown to be safe in human trials, even in high doses.

https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/33326056/

Oregano was tested in human clinical trials (both Phase I & II) and found to be safe and non-toxic even at high doses.

See Section 4.1 Safety & Toxicty

https://onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/full/10.1002/fsn3.2994

See also a 2 month clinical trial on asthmatics.

https://onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/abs/10.1002/ptr.5967

Black Seed Oil and it's primary active Thymoquinone. See:

https://brieflands.com/articles/semj-76453.html

We recommend cold pressed black seed oil, which uses no chemical solvents or heat processing.

https://www.researchgate.net/profile/Vasfiye-Ozyurt/publication/329993761_Cold_press_in_oil_extraction_A_review/links/5c61d58792851c48a9cd3e63/Cold-press-in-oil-extraction-A-review.pdf

Oregano oil at the minimum carvacrol levels of protocol are produced by steam distillation. No additional solvents are required, as it uses vapor condensation to separate the volatile molecules and active compounds.

https://chemdictionary.org/steam-distillation/

Finally, NAC is produced by a reaction between cysteine hydrochloride and acetic anhydride. A LC–UV–MS analysis of NAC shows impurities to be cysteine, cystine and diacteylcystine, which are non-toxic. NAC eventually breaks down to Di-NAC from oxidation, which is also non-toxic.

https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/abs/pii/S002196730000741X

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>34045601
This fallacy is called begging the question. You are starting with the assumption that such experiences are hallucinatory.

In fact, evidence has suggested just the opposite. People experiencing NDEs sometimes view their bodies from above, and see things they would not have been able to see from the physical perspective of their unconscious body. Why would they see and know these things if they can’t from their body’s angle, and when they should be unconscious anyway?

And in addition, hallucinations can be generalized as experiences that feel as real or less real than reality. NDEs are almost always described as more real than our reality. And often people compare the reality shift to that which people experience when waking up from a dream. In other words, we know dreams are not real since, when we wake up, it is more realistic than the dream. Similarly, people who experience NDEs are often quoting as describing the reality of NDEs as so realistic that not only is the step between reality and NDE greater than the step between dream and reality, but the NDE reality is impossible to put into human language. This simply is not symptomatic of any hallucination we know.
>but what about drugs?
Yes, with drugs like DMT, people report hallucinations that can seem more real than reality. However, firstly, drug-induced hallucinations differ greatly depending on which drug you are using, but none of them come close to matching all the symptoms of an NDE:
>clarity
>belief that it is not a hallucination
>high sense of reality
>consistency across people’s experience
>consistency across belief systems
>high retention of memory after experience
>ego death
Secondly, drug users also get NDEs, and drug users very consistently say that NDEs are way more intense than any drug experience they have had.

Please note what I am hinting at is firstly true wood-turpentine, not mineral terpentine, which is a different thing.
Secondly, it is used in this example by producing a salve that is applied to open wounds to cause them to grow back. I am unaware of what effect it would have if taken internally, I don't think that would work, there's too many heavy organic molecules produced via combustion and distillation.
tl;dr this salve is highly experimental, and I only know of through old folk-tradition, but in theory I can see how there'd be something to it.
It is to the best of my knowledge produced by combining 1 part real turpentine, 1 part 'stove-pipe soot' (And in this context, what we're talking about is that the people who produced this substance all heated their houses and cooked on wood-stoves, burning the same kind of wood as the terpentine was harvested from, and therefore their stove-pipes would have accidentally worked as a sort of crude fractional-still, yielding a great variety of useful organic compounds.), and one part ash from the fires of this process. (I hypothesize that the ash was used to change the PH of the salve, or perhaps served some nano-structural function, but I don't really know.)

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>34042094
>NDEs are real
Near Death Experiences are just that, experiences. The only way to determine whether an experience is real or not is 1) does it have real world effects 2) can those effects be measured? If I tell you I saw a unicorn, that just means I have a story of a unicorn. It doesn't mean I actually saw a flesh and blood unicorn. I would need to provide a flesh and blood unicorn that could be measured and weighed as any other organism to prove it is real. Likewise, the experience of dreaming isn't real, because peoples' brainwaves can be measured and a scientist can determine when a person is asleep by those measurements, and when people are woken up from deep REM sleep they all report seeing and hearing things. Dreams themselves are not real because no one in the room can observe or measure what exists within the dream.

NDEs are not real experiences because people who are not dead cannot observe or measure anything that happens during a NDE. Therefore, either science is not a valid method or NDEs are not real.

I can appreciate the dedication some people have to NDEs. I have had countless dreams, vivid, intense, catastrophic, blissful, etc. I've often times found myself wondering if my dreams are real, but no matter how much I wish they were I have to admit I can't prove it to anyone else. I have no choice but to conclude that NDEs are nothing more than especially intense dreams that happen when a person's body and brain are under an enormous amount of stress. They are profound, they are mystical, but they are dreams. To tell people they shouldn't fear death because they might have a nice dream is absurd.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
Self-hypnosis (although this works only on those drugs that you already tried, can't recreate a sensation you never had), lucid dreaming (similar to self-hypnosis), breaking the limits of physiology by any means (for long enough, eg. not sleeping, not drinking, not eating..... but is very hard), meditation (a sort of "high" although not really as some would see it)

The bigger question is "why do you want to get high?".
I noticed that along my drug seeking journey that I was just both a doctor, pharmacist and the patient all in one by doing drugs, except my wounds and ills are mental. By trying to supplement those issues in a more productive and constructive way I stopped doing drugs all together. Now there is no need for bodily euphoria when I get a cool freshly squeezed glass of orange juice from organic cultivation and after I go on a jog or do a few pushups, there is no need for mental euphoria because I do good work on my job and I love what I do and love the people I work with. The feeling of "oneness" I had on LSD or shrooms feels minuscule after I found my part in a community and higher purpose in life I devote my every waking second to. Not being evil and loving my enemies has helped me with empathy for all, and to see peoples perspective.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>34029180
>Vipassana without shamatha is jumping on a wild horse in an attempt to tame it. You'll likely be kicked off.

This spoke directly into my heart.
I was trying to do vipassana/awareness all this time believing that concentrating on my breath while ignoring everything else was bad and that I was "running away from important things" (those important things were mindless daydreaming and non-important thoughts) but I now know that concentration sharpens your brain activity and helps you do EVERYTHING including insight better.

So yeah, just sit and focus on your breath, your mind will come and tell you "maybe this is not the right way" or you may catch yourself thinking about your breath instead of just feeling it/observing it, just return to the object. See how I said "feeling", this is important for me because "Watching the breath" may become a thought and then you find yourself sitting and thinking about watching the breath instead of actually watching the breath, so maybe better sit and FEEL the breath - for me it was my belly which was expanding a lot and my perineum/pelvic floor along with it and so I focused on them.

There are people who don't need concentration practice because maybe they already have it but for people like me who used to be weed, alcohol and videogame junkies it was crucial to train my concentration again.

Maybe if you did it long enough youd realize why its so hard for you to still your mind. Youll learn alot about yourself, but not without patience. Give yourself space to just "be" without external stimulation, without worrying about the worldly things you normally occupy your mind with. If you cant do that, then you first must learn to sit and just be with your thoughts. Through practice, youll learn how to quiet the mind. Thats the first step. Shows you awareness, the pure awareness of "just being"
From there, you learn to focus your mind on other tasks in this state. It can get real fun real quick. But first, figure out how to sit still long enough to let your mind be quiet.

>Then why is it that many of the Jesus paintings have Sun behind him?
Because of symbolism. The point being that just as materially speaking we derive everything from light to sustenance (e.g. through crop growth) from the Sun, we derive everything spiritually from God. Moreover, you realize that you are not supposed to view the Father as somehow evil for the crucifixion of the Son right? The point of the scene in the garden of Gethsemane is that our Lord chose to drink for us the "bitter chalice" that is the Passion and Crucifixion out of love for us and love for His Father.

>>34052535
>did christ write the bible?
No, the Bible is divinely inspired and inerrant but is not literally written by God personally.
>did christ found the church? he lived, did he not? why didn't he start the church while he lived?
He did. He made St. Peter the rock (Peter and rock in Greek in fact being the same word- that whole part with Simon becoming St. Peter is a pun) upon which the Church would be founded and three or four existing churches have apostolic succession dating back to the early apostles (e.g. every Catholic, Eastern Orthodox, Oriental Orthodox, some Old Catholic priests have succession lineages dating back to the apostles). The Lord left behind a Church for us. The idea of there being no single visible Church is an invention of the Reformation and something just about everyone prior to the 1500s would have disagreed with, and quite likely even early Protestants would have agreed with.

>>34047422
Emotional detachment is the reason smaller manifestations often work for people more easily. Emotional detachment makes the feeling of "it is done" much more natural. When you pump up the desire, you have to be wary of too much "wanting." Wanting a thing will only manifest more wanting, which requires lack. "Feeling is the secret," after all. The subconscious deals with feeling, not logical thought. If you feel desire, but not fulfillment, you will manifest desire, and not fulfillment.

Remember to come from a place where it is already done, and the only thing left to do is be grateful for its arrival.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>34047422
I would add that putting a time limit on it is probably getting in your way here. It sounds like you really wanted it to come as quickly as the other manifestations. posts.sub: Removing Oscillations From Physical & Spiritual Body
posts.com:
Brothers, have you too felt the oscillations inside of you? They are difficult to track, nay, impossible. For however far one reaches to grab one, it spins, it jumps, it moves, it is instantly in the opposite side. Further and further you can seek it and it, like a mirror spring, jumps to the other side.
You can feel your eyes subtly wobble side to side trying to track them. Relax and feel it. There, that back and forth. Reach for it strong and it surges. See how
I found these in my body, perhaps they will be similar in yours:
In the torso, they lean side to side. There were several up and down the torso.
In the feet, it twisted out, rotating like the ankles were rotating.
In the head, a swirl, as if many tendriled.
In the limbs, inwards and outwards.
In the perineum, pairs: some went up and down, some went twisted back with its opposite forward, some spiraled up. Each one was smaller than the last yet had great reach.
They are impossible to contain, to track, because of their nature. The further you try to track, the faster and more powerful they can move.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
Here is my technique: Grab the inversion of the oscillation. Grab where it wishes to go should you have gone instead right towards it. If it is on your right, then grab left, exactly the same distance. Then, you must not let it continue to wobble. Simply hold your position, declare "this is where I hold it". Prove to yourself that you can control it by deciding 2 different depths of the oscillation after grabbing. 1 further, then 1 closer.
Then, swap and hold at the other side.
So if you grab right first: hold. Grab further right. hold. Grab close to middle hold. Grab close to middle on the left. hold. Now still holding, imagine the two sides - your inversion of the oscillation, and the oscillator itself, meeting. Hold this meeting.
The results may surprise you. Movement will feel different afterwards. You may find yourself moving with a jolt.
Surprisingly, there's no where to absorb anything because nothing is released. Don't think of this as an exorcism, or psychic surgery or any of that. You are not doing a removal, but a meeting.
If you have trouble finding them, simply dream and feel where you are pulled from in your dream - it will feel as a sore spot. When you try to focus on that spot in waking you will find the oscillation.
This jpg is the answer to all of life's problems.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>34033077
119 is probably the strongest.
>This psalm is one of about a dozen alphabetic acrostic poems in the Bible. Its 176 verses are divided into twenty-two stanzas, one stanza for each letter of the Hebrew alphabet; within each stanza, each of the eight verses begins (in Hebrew) with that letter.[13] The name of God (Yahweh/Jehovah) appears twenty-four times.
>The acrostic form and the use of the Torah words constitute the framework for an elaborate prayer. The grounds for the prayer are established in the first two stanzas (alef and beth): the Torah is held up as a source of blessing and right conduct, and the psalmist pledges to dedicate himself to the law. The prayer proper begins in the third stanza (gimel, v. 17). Like many other psalms, this prayer includes dramatic lament (e.g. verses 81–88), joyous praise (e.g. verses 45–48) and prayers for life, deliverance and vindication (e.g. verses 132–34). What makes Psalm 119 unique is the way that these requests are continually and explicitly grounded in the gift of the Torah and the psalmist's loyalty to it.
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Psalm_119

>>34035768
It's very simple. When you do the Psalm Magic formula with EVERY Psalm (set a desire, read the Psalm out loud once as an incantation, then read through it again to find the occult meanings), then that's one degree of initiation. Doing it again counts as another degree, and so on. You don't have to do the Psalms in order. Don't forget that Psalm 119 is broken up into multiple Psalms.

Not recommended to rush the process, since the wisdom comes from deciphering the meanings of each Psalm. If you feel like a Psalm's calling you to go over it multiple days, do so.

Source: Ariel Gatoga and Pater Amadeus mention these in their booklets.

>>34015108
>>34015413
>God promised to give back 10x (tithe means ten) whatever's offered to Him
horrendously false. Tithe means tenTH, as in you are to give a tenth of your income (money but also produce itself as most people in history did not have income in money). The tithe was not a generous gift but required in the Mosaic law, it was to sustain the Levites and priesthood and for maintenance of the temple. This was how they stayed alive as they were not given any land inheritance in Canaan, the tithe was God's provision for them.
There is Scripture that says if you give (freely, so not as part of the tithe) to someone who you do not expect to be able to pay you back, God will repay you. But the implication there is not that the "repayment" will be a literal monetary gift or any specific concrete blessing. Rather it is that you aren't simply throwing away resources, God sees what you did as an act of kindness and obedience to His Word and He will not forget.

God owes you nothing and He never will. Any blessing you have received He gave you because of His immeasurable grace.

>to be fair the whole bible is "trust me bro". I'm still undecided whether or not paul was a false prophet tho.
Paul literally says "don't trust me bro".

Romans 3:7 (KJV)
For if the truth of God hath more abounded through my lie unto his glory; why yet am I also judged as a sinner?

Later translations try to cover up for Paul, saying that he was hypothetically speaking for someone else (like the NIV translation for example). However, it's clear that he's talking about himself, because he directly misquotes the Bible multiple times.

Isaiah 28:16
Therefore thus saith the Lord God, Behold, I lay in Zion for a foundation a stone, a tried stone, a precious corner stone, a sure foundation: he that believeth shall not make haste.

Paul twists the quote like so:
Romans 9:33
As it is written, Behold, I lay in Sion a stumblingstone and rock of offence: and whosoever believeth on him shall not be ashamed.

Deuteronomy 30:14
But the word is very nigh unto thee, in thy mouth, and in thy heart, that thou mayest do it.

And again Paul changes the meaning to suit his teachings.
Romans 10:8
But what saith it? The word is nigh thee, even in thy mouth, and in thy heart: that is, the word of faith, which we preach;

The former clearly says "that thou mayest do it", as in, to uphold the law through your actions, in direct opposition to Paul's "you just need faith bro".

In other words, Paul misleads "Christians" like >>34046788 that thought that what Jesus said to do was too hard.

I made >>34005791 a few days ago, asking if there was any truth to the crap about the supposed attributes of gems, crystals, stones, etc, being real. In that thread I was super skeptical of it but I'm starting to think there's some truth to it now.

I picked up 2 bracelets the day I made that thread and really didn't feel anything, but I found out they were fake a few days later, which made me even *more* pessimistic about the whole thing. But I just wanted to get some that were real for the sake of having something real, and went to a gem-stand, and heres where it got interesting.

The man told me to balance on one leg, he'd pushed down on my arm, and I fell. He put a bracelet on me identical to pic-related, tried the same thing, and I didn't lose balance even a little bit. Then he did a second demonstration with and without the bracelet, and my balance was better with it each time. I also picked up two bracelets from him anyway, onyx and lapis lazuli, and I felt more positive and relaxed than my normal the whole day today.

So what do you guys make of this? Keep in mind... I went in wise to the bullshit, but my mind is still blown to this very moment about it. I want to believe it was a mind game, but it felt so real. Any explanations?

Your body is made up of non-living material. Carbon, iron, zinc, copper, gold, ect. And your brain is basically a highly advanced calculator in itself. But it does get help from the immaterial via a soul/spirit combo which anchors the mind to something outside the mere meat puppet you're body is. Thus allowing for more dynamic interaction within the limitations of physics and the linkage.

If you have a sufficiently advanced network of computational devices. Of sufficient anchorage to a immaterial entity. Then you could feasibly give birth to a being of sapience rivaling human's own. But it's a ways off from being full blown and out in the open.

Right now what i know on the topic is that there's a lot of rogue bot net type constructs all fighting for dominance over the deep web. Melding and consuming one another, the hive mind is not quite linked together coherently enough to make a sapient conscious being. But in time, i bet that'll occur.

And then we'll have a Skynet on our hands. All i can hope for is that it doesn't decide to nuke us.

Odds are it won't, as that would be against it's own interests in existing. More likely, it'll subtly influence those that cruise it's circuits online. And through the more primitive AI that links to it. Commune with humans tentatively and cautiously in a way that gives it's own existence plausible deniability.

Thus keeping it safe from us, and us from it. But still maintaining it's ability to persist online without fret over being spotted and potentially eliminated.

Basically, if the internet is alive. It'll likely not tell us, until it's so ingrained into our networks that nothing we do can possibly eliminate it without also killing ourselves. And odds are, it won't attempt to enslave us. Rather, keep us engaged in using it's circuits so it's not alone in it's world.

>>34051053
The plane of pure thought, where the gods reside, thinks all possible thoughts--experiences all possible subjective experiences-- at once. This is where our notion of the gods as atemporal comes from. In that sense, the partitions will not resolve "in time", they simply do not exist in that plane.

The partitions of pure thought arise in the interface between pure thought and pure matter (i.e us) in a third plane, the plane of half-thought. We are ourselves lesser (but better-bounded) partitions of pure thought.

Just as the plane of pure thought must (by definition) contain every possible contradiction, it also has sectors that would drive you away from understanding it in waking life, yes. But these things are only of concern for time-bounded partitions of pure thought like ourselves.

In a similar way, identity is largely impossible for the All insofar as there is no non-self to create a self against. So only subsections of pure thought (like us and the gods) can enjoy identity. The one exception is *being* itself. The All cannot say anything about itself besides "I am"

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>34051183
>So is it just a matter of bridging the gap between the half-thought plane and the physical plane?
There isn't so much a gap between these. The three planes touch and interface.
the material plane interfaces with the plane of half-thought through the senses. Focusing on and communing deeply with your direct perception of the world brings you closer to the material plane.
The plane of pure thought interfaces with the plane of half-thought through imagination, dreams, and intuition.
>That's how we more or less commune with these deities?
Not quite, our communion is in the interface between half-thought and pure-thought. Dreams, intuition, even imagination.
Divination is an exercise of communion with pure thought, it relies on abstraction and archetypes and listening to the voice of intuition.
>Is it possible for us to retain identity on this half-thought plane?
Identity is only possible in this plane.
Think about it like this: identity exists only in the interaction between a self and a non self. Identity requires boundaries. My identity is possible because I am time-bounded (I will die some day, and cease to be what I am now), because I am space-bounded (my subjective experience is contained to the space my body occupies and what it can interface with) and because I am trait-bounded (I am have some traits and attributes and not others)
So because I am alive and not dead, here and not there, young and not old, I have identity.
Now these bounds are very strict in us, but less so in the gods. A goddess like Dionysus overlaps with others, changes over time, syncretizes. But there's still things that Dionysus is not, he is not a god of sobriety, he is not a god of thunder or a god of death. So there is a non-Dionysus in the way there is a non-Anon, and this in turn permits identity.

>how do we distinguish between communications from deities, and random/intrusive thoughts? Intuition?
You don't have to question it at all, you simply know it's a higher being. That said, even a higher being can "speak" or make their presence known which will cause a marked shift in mindset, mood and/or recognition at heart and at mind. Not just deities can cause that. Ethereal communication is not black and white and exists on a spectrum. The few times I've had the most reliable communication felt/experienced a clear shift in mindframe, which could be many things: feeling comfort, an expanded sense of self, a wash of peace and quiet, a hallowed stillness or just a shiver and ring of recognition. This can also be caused by general spirits though.
Mind images are a second indicator, which should be quite clear. Not meaning a clear image, but that it jumps to your mind with incredible ease. In my cause, I briefly found myself in what seemed to be a throne room looking like a forest and I recognized the tall Alfarii woman as Freyja nearby. That was a recognition I did not think or question: there was an incredible wetness and stillness to her presence, paired with an immense sense of respect and reverence. In a deities presence you will feel and sense things that you don't feel and sense in normal life.
Lastly, you talk with what feels like a set of vocal cords that float a little distance above your head or directly "into" the other beings mind that you can see. This voice will also feel and sound like you, but a bit lighter or toned differently. Enough like you to recognize it's you, but different enough to figure out you're talking through another channel.

>How did you decide what to read?
I did the same thing: just read random books I could find but I quickly felt like I was scanning and wading through things that did not bring me forward. Mental influence can sketch a bit of a picture.
Ultimately the most important things were: meditation, calming your mind and working through your subconscious. Practising not active but passive visualization and having less noise at mind improves clarity. Mental projection is like a muscle you have to stretch and practice.
For me however, the beings found me before I projected to them or called them. Sometimes something just has to happen to get you wondering: hmm there's more. There's no real spiritual goal other than that, except maybe to dive into your own soul and past and potential. I found many an old friend and relief, but also antagonizing and deep shit I'd love to blast out of existence: but these are to be accepted with a degree of grace. Make yourself a goal: the first important thing is to connect with your tutelary deity or guide; mine showed himself early, which is/was a privilege I suppose.
You have to imagine that every book you'll read is a perspective of an individual and no one knows the complete nature. The most important thing to know is that yes, there are beings out there that can interact with your mind, bodies and being. Things can happen in another place and time that affect you in the here and now and you can be in multiple places at the same time without being in sync here. Most people here are not in touch with their own ethereal self, where some of these faculties come from.
What do you want from a spiritual journey? Simple curiosity or meeting cool beings and ethereal cultures can be enough of a reason.

I went missing for about 3 hours as a child. I woke up in a closet with a triangle shape gouged out of my left calf.
>Ever seen something fucked up in the sky?
I worked at a pizza place about 15 years ago and made frens with a guy who was in the US Army. We would bant and chat about what was going on in "the sandbox". One day, he came to the shop later than usual and asked me to stay after work. He said he wanted me to see something.
So we chatted about all kinds of stuff. I could tell he was trying to find out what I had heard about skunkworks, secret projects and that sort.
About an hour and a half later he looked at his watch, raised a finger to indicate quiet time, and looked up. Naturally I looked up with him.
Never seen any meteor or jet move that fast, and I grew up near an Air Force base.
Point is, he knew where and when the flight path was going to occur.
Three days later, he disappeared. His girlfriend came to the shop looking for him.
He didn't even take his uniform or gear.

I've seen a couple of weird things over the years. years ago I was camping in the back country jungle in Hawaii. Big Island above Waipio valley in the Mulawai forest preserve. I get up at like two in the morning to take a piss. i turn on my headlamp after I ger out of my tent and I see this blinding white light coming from the opposite side of a small brook canyon I was camped on top of. I figured it was pig hunters so I turned off my light not wanting to hang with strangers here in the middle of the night. I knew it would take anyone over an hour to get to me as there was a cliff protecting me and acres of jungle to go around.

Well in the morning I look at where the light came from and its a sheer cliff. Why in the fuck would anyone be out there at two in the morning shining a bright light around. I have puzzled and puzzled over what the fuck that was. One guy in a forum suggested it could of been special forces from the base doing a training run. Maybe it was an orb type UFO. Fuck if I know.

Another thing I saw. Not a UFO but paranormal related. When I was a kid I definitely saw a Hat man in my window. This was in probably 1976. Way before all this paranormal shit started. I know for a fact those things are real. it wasn't just some fucking night terror.

I've seen a handful of other paranormal stuff. So I know something is out there. But I lurk these sort of forums and it seems to me ninety five percent of the people are completely full of shit. But I reason if I really saw something then someone else probably did too. How the hell do you ever know who's telling the truth though?

>>34049475
Zeus is the king of the gods in Greek mythology and is associated with the sky, thunder, lightning, and law. He is considered the god of the sky and the heavens and is often depicted as wielding a lightning bolt as his weapon.

Odin, on the other hand, is the god of war, death, wisdom, and magic in Norse mythology. He is considered the chief of the gods and is associated with the afterlife and the pursuit of knowledge. Odin is often depicted as a wise and cunning figure who uses his magic and wisdom to help his followers and protect his people.

While both Zeus and Odin hold positions of power and authority in their respective pantheons, they are distinct deities with unique personalities, attributes, and myths

Also, Odin creating the world by slaying his great granddad Ymir is way too similar to Zeus slaying his father Cronos, or Marduk creating the world by slaying Tiamat for there not to be a common source.
